chargeHist.descr: Repeated Sexual Assault of Same Child (fewer than 3 Violations of 1st Degree Sexual Assault)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Koji S Haskins was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 4th Degree Sexual Assault, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3m).
  • Exposing genitals to a child, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.10(1)(a).
  • Exposing genitals to a child, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.10(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Restitution set at zero
Court costs and victim/witness surcharges are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid by 4/5/2019; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge  to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid by 4/5/2019; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
Consecutive to: consecutive to any other sentence and consecutive to Count 3, to be served in the Wisconsin State Prison system, credit for 0 days.

AS TO EACH COUNT:  Restitution set at zero.
Court costs and victim/witness surcharges are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid by 4/5/2019; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge  to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid by 4/5/2019; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
Consecutive to: consecutive to any other sentence, but concurrent to Counts 1 and 3, credit for 0 days.

superMiscConds.notes: Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.
Mental health assessment and any recommended treatment to include any counseling, therapy and taking any prescribed medications.

No alcohol or controlled substances.
No contact with M.C.R.

Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking Behavioral Modification Program.
Successfully complete a Parenting Program.
Defendant to be assessed for sexual offender treatment and participate in any treatment if applicable.
Defendant must comply with the sex offender registry for a period of 5 years.

AODA assessment and any recommended treatment.
Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzers.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: consecutive to any other sentence, but concurrent to Count 2, credit for 0 days.

records.addlTxt: Certification of SENTENCING HEARING transcript commencing AUGUST 5, 2015, received and filed. (54 Pages)  Copy of transcript forwarded to:  REQUIRED BY STATUTE
Amended on the record and rescanned. sab

Defendant Koji S Haskins in court with attorney Christian Thomas Eichenlaub.  Defendant Koji S Haskins in custody.  Cynthia M. Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
 Correction made to the presenternce report. Sentencing Proceeded. Statements by the State, defense counsel and defendant. 
AS TO COUNT 1:
The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 8 months in the House of Correction, consecutive to any othjer sentence and consecutive to Count 3, to be served in the Wisconsin State Prison system, credit for 0 days.
AS TO COUNT 2:
The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 30 MONTHS.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 12 MONTHS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 18 MONTHS, consecutive to any other sentence, but concurrent to Counts 1 and 3, credit for 0 days.
AS TO COUNT 3:
The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 36 MONTHS.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 18 MONTHS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 18 MONTHS, consecutive to any other sentence, but concurrent to Count 2, credit for 0 days.
Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
-Restitution set at zero
-Court costs and victim/witness surcharges are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid by 4/5/2019; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge  to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid by 4/5/2019; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
-AODA assessment and any recommended treatment
-Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzers
-No alcohol or controlled substances
-Mental health assessment and any recommended treatment to include any couseling, therapy and taking any prescribed medications
-Part time employment or school
-Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking Behavioral Modification Program
-Successfully complete a Parenting Program
-No contact with M.C.R.
-Defendant to be assessed for sexual offender treatment and participate in any treatment if applicable
*Defendant must comply with the sex offender registry for a period of 5 years
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.
Filed, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence
Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Filed, Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement
Defense sentencing memorandum received and filed. sab
Sentencing Memorandum and Court Report filed by CSS Yulonda Anderson from WI State Public Defenders Office.
PSI emailed to ADA Davis and Atty Eichenlaub

Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, and further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. Defendant, examined as to plea, and entered a plea of guilty.  Court found defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived all constitutional rights. Plea questionnaire waiver of rights and addendum to plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulated to the final paragraph of the criminal complaint as factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Amended Information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered into the record.  The Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms/body armor.    Court further advised defendant of voting ineligibility.    All parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be assigned to Judge Watts, Branch 15,  in Room 502 of the Safety Building. Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 15.   Court ordered DEFENDANT REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff.

Defendant Koji S Haskins in court with attorney Christian Thomas Eichenlaub.  Defendant Koji S Haskins in custody.  Cynthia M. Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case calendared for jury trial.     
Filed, original amended information; copy served on defendant. Court ordered charge amended to:
Count 1: 4th degree sexual assault, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 940.225(3m), 939.51(3)(a), a Class A misdemeanor.
Counts 2 and 3: Exposing genitals or pubic area, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 948.10(1) and (1) (a), 939.50(3)(i), a Class I felony.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 5, 2015 at 08:30 am.

ADA Cynthia Davis appears for the state of Wisconsin.
Defendant in custody and appears by Atty Christian Eichenlaub.  In chambers discussion held.  Negotiations continue. Case remains on for trial 7-6-2015.

Attorney Christian Thomas Eichenlaub in court, defendant Koji S Haskins not in court, in custody.  Cynthia M. Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy Court Clerk:  ss

States request for an adjourned trial date is denied by the court.  Joint request for an adjourned final pretrial date is granted by the court. m   Court ordered case adjourned for final pre-trial conference in Branch 38  Final pre-trial scheduled for 07-02-2015 at 08:15 am.

Attorney Christian Thomas Eichenlaub in court, defendant Koji S Haskins not in court, in custody.  Jesica Ballenger appeared for Cindy Davis for the State of Wisconsin.
  Case set for final pretrial/projected plea on 5-7-2015 at 8:15am.  Jury trial set for 7-6-2015 at 8:15am.  All final pretrial documents to be filed by the final pretrial hearing.  All motions to be filed by 4-6-2015.

Defendant Koji S Haskins in court with attorney Christian Thomas Eichenlaub.  Defendant Koji S Haskins in custody.  Ron Dague for Cynthia M. Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Steve Wells-MPD Detective.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 38.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 5, 2015 at 08:15 am.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION INCLUDING DRUG TESTING.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  
Defendant to have no contact with: MCR ( 8/10/2000) and Parents.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Koji S Haskins in court with attorney Brian B. Burke.  Defendant Koji S Haskins in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 17, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
